Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: RealKathy
Reviews.Content: Near Las Ramblas, easy to find. Near enough to the bus stop from the airport. We shared shower room, toilet room, and the shower/toilet/sink room. Sink in our room. Bring washcloth and hand soap. 3rd floor, back corner room is perfectly quiet. Clothes line and clothes pins are accessible from window, however, if anything drops into the courtyard below, it might be impossible to retrieve. Not fancy. No elevator. We liked this hostal very much and would stay here again. We are bargain travelers and the price was right. Very clean. We always bring ear plugs and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hostal, not amazing”
Reviews.Author: sariberry
Reviews.Content: I would give this 3.5 stars if I could. It's really a good option, but nothing fantastic. The staff is friendly and the rooms and shared bathrooms are kept clean. We paid 50 euro (does not include breakfast), which is a good deal for a private room so close to Las Ramblas. However, the walls are paper thin (we could hear everything our neighbors were saying), there's no wifi in the room (although you can get it downstairs in the lobby), and there's no safes to lock up your valuables. So while I think it's a good deal, I wouldn't say it's outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price, high standards in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: michaelmacginty
Reviews.Content: Hostal Campi is a basic Hostal, offering a great location, safe area, friendly very clean accomodation near city centre in Barrio Gothic. Staff are very helpful and friendly and all do their jos very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, especially on a short trip”
Reviews.Author: hdempsey
Reviews.Content: We began a 16 day trip across Europe with two night in Barcelona. We arrived jet lagged and in the evening so we were relieved to find this place fairly easy to get to and find coming from the airport. As noted by other reviewers, they don't have an elevator. We knew this going in so it wasn't so bad. There were plenty of great places to eat in the vicinity (and throughout the city). Located at the top of the Ramblas it was in a great spot to get around and see Barcelona. I also found it clean, and safe. On our last day we checked out early and left our bags there in the bag storage all day with no problem. They keep them tagged in a separate room behind a desk, monitored by the person at the front desk. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hostel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week in Fall 2011. A room with shared bath was 58euro, and with private bath was 69euro. The good: This hostel is super close to everything: Las Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter, El Raval, La Rivera, and Placa Catalunya which is a travel hub for the entire city. For the price, you can't do much better. The not-so-good: The decor is rather drab and the rooms are on the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th floors of a building with no lift. The towels are very starchy and the maids replace them every day even if you hang them on the hooks next to the sign that says "Help save the environment: if you hang your towel on the hook the maid will not wash it..." All things considered, the staff is very nice and the place did not feel in the least bit sketchy, which is wonderful in a neighborhood that is relatively sketchy in general.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: MegsyB
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights in this beautiful city.the hostel could not have been more perfect! Absolutely fantastic location,right in the heart of where things seem to happen,perfect being so close to placa de catalunya as thats where all the metro lines change etc. Though as I'm happy to walk everywhere so as to really get to see the city it was nice and central for that too but when feet were burning,it was great being so close to the metro! I had the cheapest room going,single without shower / wc - I was a bit nervous about this but budget commanded this option! I have to say it was not a problem at all,showers were always free,wc's always free and both were very clean.the room itself was basic but comfortable,nice to come home to after a long day. The best thing I could stay is that if I were going back to the city again,I would not hesitate in the slightest or even bother to look around,this is a perfect, basic, fantastically located stay! Also,the staff were very helpful with lots of recommendations and advice! 10 out of 10 :)

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: leekm
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews, this hostal was truly clean and comfortable. The location, at the top of La Ramblas and near to La Boqueria, is very convenient as it's a downhill walk south to the rest of Las Ramblas and Port Vell. It's a 5 minutes walk north to Plaza Catalunya, where there is the El Corte Ingles supermarket, the metro and various bus lines are. To the east, is Barri Gothic, where the Barcelona cathedral (not the Sagrada Familia) is nearby where one can watch the Sardana dance on Saturday and Sunday. So one can eat cheaply at La Boqueria or buy from the supermarket, and there are tons of eateries all around. The fan was a necessity in summer. Even on the fourth floor, one can hear some revellers and cleaning trucks in the wee hours, but it's bearable. The location on the 4th floor (91 steps!) - without a lift- can be a concern with heavy luggage or after a long day or both! The steps have been worn rather smooth and I slipped on a step once, going downstairs with luggage. My only feeling of discontent was the price which as compared with other cities is rather high, given the facilities. In all fairness, this is reflective of prices in Barcelona, where for some attractions, the price increased by about 20% in one year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: angelat33
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location for your stay in Barcelona. Only a block off the Las Ramblas, right by the metro and bus stops and o so close to La Boqueria; I cannot wait to go back. The room was clean and quiet. Two shared bathrooms very clean. The hosts were extremely helpful with directions and meal suggestions. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great staying”
Reviews.Author: brutalbrat
Reviews.Content: Our second time here and for accessibility (close to Las Rambles and Metro) and value for money you will go far to find something better. Staff friendly and ever helpful. Just realise that you would have to be able to climb stairs seeing that the hostal is sprawled over the top floors of the building. No-aircon, but fans! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “good location and clean place”
Reviews.Author: harneetbaweja
Reviews.Content: Great Location and good clean accommodation and very safe. Must mention fernando was a great help. Has great tips for good restaurants around the area. Not so good: try an avoid antonio(he works there), can single handedly destroy your trip. Not the best way to experience the party that is barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Adequate Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ktgarvai
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean. Someone comes in daily to change the sheets and straighten the room. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Bathrooms were shared, but always available. The balcony overlooked a side street that was a bit noisy at times, but not enough to be disturbing. The location cannot be any better, safe and close to metros and Las Ramblas. There is a large grocery store across the street and is close to La Boqueria Market. What it lacks in charm it makes up for in location.

Reviews.Title: “Soft beds, close to Ramblas, but on a quiet side street”
Reviews.Author: Kauai2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a double bed and an en suite bathroom. The room was clean and the bed was very soft, which was not the case for the other hostals that we stayed at in Spain. We were able to check in early and there is always staff at the front desk. You leave your key at the front desk when you leave the building and then are buzzed in every time you come back. There were quite a bit of stairs to get up to the hostal, and I'm not sure if there was an elevator or not. There are computers in the commons room that you can pay to use the internet. If you have your own laptop, they do have free wireless internet as well. In the commons room is a bookshelf with books that you can borrow. At night, we did see quite a few other guests hanging out in the commons room using the computers. This hostal is located very close to the Ramblas, but on a side street, so it is quiet at night. It is close to the catalunya metro stop which is at the top of the Ramblas. Our bathroom faucet only had hot water, which was only a problem when we ran the water to do something like wash our faces and the water got pretty hot. The hot and cold water was very sensitive in the shower so it took some time to adjust the water to get the temperature comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Try and Get a Room Off the Main Street”
Reviews.Author: Jack-Dru
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a very loud city at night, all night. So a room off the main street would be your best bet. The location, off Las Ramblas is excellent. And the five floors you have to walk up to get to your room is good for the legs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Cyclistyo
Reviews.Content: Rooms were simple, but clean. Shared bathroom was also clean. We got a room in the back so it was quiet, but the rooms facing the side street could get quite noisy if the crowd is out on Ramblas after a Barca game! Very convenient to everything. Excellent location. PC available for rent.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TravelEMG
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hostel/hotel was the location. Oh and it was clean, which is important. My friend and I had a twin room with shared toilets/showers and they were always clean. The staff was generally nice, except for one of the night staff. I got in on a flight to Reus just before midnight and had to take the shuttle to Barcelona, putting me in around 1:30am. I called the hostel asking directions from the Sants station to them by night bus. The person who was working the night shift did NOT speak English. I could NOT understand what he was saying, and he was very, VERY rude. So I ended up having to take a cab. I don't care if it's just the night shift, if your hostel advertises to English-speaking travelers, all of their staff, regardless of time of day should speak English. AND all of the staff should know how to get from the main train stations to the hostel at any time of day or night. When I finally arrived at the hostel, the same person was extremely rude to me. And the next night he was rude to my friend when she asked him a question. All the rest of the staff there were fine though. The other thing of note - we could hear street noise in our room. We did keep the window cracked for most of the time though. I suppose the rooms that were not facing the street probably did not hear street noise. Oh, and finally - they charge for internet if you don't have your own computer (I brought mine, but still I don't remember seeing it on their website that they charge for internet). I'd stay there again, but I'd call during the day to get directions if I was going to arrive late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: sbird10
Reviews.Content: Nice sized room, clean, comfortable. Excellent, informative staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, very quite and a good price / quality relationship”
Reviews.Author: El_Commandante_2010
Reviews.Content: After I stayed in a very stylish, but noisy design / boutique Hotel at the beginning of my Barcelona trip I moved to the Hostal for the rest of my journey. After two days in a noisy hotel with sleepless nights staying in Hostal Campi felt like a relief. Although it is perfectly located in a shoping street of the Old city just ~100 meters from "La Rambla" and ~400 meters from "Plaza Catalunya" it´s very quite in the Hostal with just little noise from outside. The staff is very friendly and helpfull, the interior is typical Hostal like (that means basic), but it´s clean with good beds / matrasses. I especially liked the central location, it was very nice strolling through the streets of the old city in the evening and always being back to the Hostal very quickly once the feet were aching too much. In total a very good price / value relationship...

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Luc-Pascal
Reviews.Content: Clean and well located. The roof leaked a little during one night in our room. They changed us at our request to a better room. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but clean and close to all best places in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PlainTraveller
Reviews.Content: 1...2...3...4... the distance from this hostel to most of the "points of interest" in Barcelona can be measured in meters! It's right in the heart of the city, just 50 m from Rambla, still it is a quiet place with very basic, but clean rooms and friendly staff. Fresh towels and bedding, hot water all day long, even central heating on cold October nights. Unfortunately, no tea/coffee available, but with so many cafes and bars around open almost 24/7 this is not a problem. Recommended for travellers who are happy with basic conditions, but at that price and with this location there is no better offer in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Charu666
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hostel, perfect if you don't want shared dorms and rather enjoy Barcelona with your partner or friends. The price is really good, specially considering that you're right in the meddle of the touristic part of Barcelona. Literally meters away from Las Ramblas, the main street of the Old Town. There were some cheaper alternatives, but they were often far from the centre or not that clean... I was impressed by the cleanliness of the hostel, it was spotless clean. Our room was cleaned everyday and even the bedsheets were changed once, during our stay. The staff were friendly and helpful when we asked about places to see and things to do. The only "con" this hostel has is the stairs. 2 flights of them just to get to the reception and one more to get to the rooms. If you hate stairs you won't like this place. They also don't serve breakfast but, being right at the centre, it wasn't difficult to find a place. I wouldn't recommend this hostel if you are going to Barcelona to meet lots of people and go partying, the hostel was really quiet at night though it was open 24h.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: sunlover831
Reviews.Content: Great location! Short walk from the Metro and right on the insanely happening Las Rambla, yet somehow it is also quiet. It's about a 20min walk to the beach. The rooms are good, we had one without a bathroom, but it still had a sink and was a good size, never had to que for the showers so that was fine. Good sound proofing between rooms as well which was good. The only down is that there is no lift, so when you first arrive you have to heave your backs up a few flights of stairs, but its not a big deal. They have two computers in reception area which is 0.50euro for half an hour which was really handy. Overall I would recommend this as a good place to stay, the rooms were nice, cleaned daily, and the location is really good. It's way better than staying in a hostel dorm, but if you're after hotel luxury then it's not for you. It is a good, simple, decent priced hotel without all the frills like room service. The one negative is that it doesn't have air con, only a fan - I didn't think to check when I booked and we were there at the height of summer - so it's probably fine most of the year, just a bit hot in august without aircon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: iloveeurope13
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I are backpacking through Europe. This hostel is more like a pension (Rick Steves would probably love it). Totally safe, perfect location, nicest people - no complaints at all. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: kukiimnzta
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and very basic. We were very close to the buses/trains/shopping and la rambla so I can't complain. The price was also right for being so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: lillipod
Reviews.Content: A basic accommodation that serves its purpose. Not loud neighbours (except for a bunch of Americans talking out loud some rooms down!), no annoying church bells throughout the night. Common toilet and shower/bath are very clean. Reception is nice but could do with a bit more service smiles :-)

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else”
Reviews.Author: bkpoalnd
Reviews.Content: Ugh! The staff is so rude here! And only leave your luggage here, if you are okay with it sitting out in an unsecured room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: karichiqi
Reviews.Content: It was in a great location! Right next to the Ramblas and the Ramblas metro station. Value was good. We had a triple room. room had three twin beds. No AC, so windows were always open. Beds were comfy. There were extra small pillows and comforters in the closet. We had room without shower. We had a sink in the room - the bathroom was in the hallway two doors down. There were two showers and two toilets per floor. This hostal is about 3 floors. (Located at the 3rd - 5th floors of the building no elevators!) Showers were great- big- and always had hot water. Service was great. Maid cleaned the rooms daily. Front desk gave us a map- spoke english- and was able to help us out a lot to find this or give directions. They even lent me a hair blow dryer at 10:30 at night. It was great. You leave your key at the desk whenever you leave the building, and they buzz you in at the front door. There is always someone at the desk. There is no wifi but there is a computer room right next to the front desk with a printer. Internet is 0.5 euros per 30min and 0.10 euros to print when we went. It was reasonable. Overall, pretty good deal and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: MRC2104
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days last February. The hostel (it's really more of a budget hotel than a hostel) is a good deal. It's well positioned between Las Ramblas and the Barrio Gotico and a short walk to the beach. The rooms are clean and secure, but the upper floors had a strange smell about them. The staff was generally pleasant, with a single notable exception who was unpleasantly sullen. If you're looking for some place cheap and basic then it's not a bad choice, but next time I will pay a bit to get the better experience...

Reviews.Title: “Super Camp”
Reviews.Author: DMV1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the summer, great value for money, rooms were fantastic. Location is superb, literally just off the rambla and the staff are lovely. If your going to Barca on a budget...........i would recommend this place 10 times over!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Campi
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer de Canuda, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
